title: Picnic Food Ideas
description: Picnic season is here! Need a little inspiration? Iâ€™ve rounded up some of my favorite Picnic Food Ideas to get you started. Everything on this list is easy to pack, holds up well in the heat, and is perfect for your next outdoor adventure. Pressed Italian Sandwiches If you wanna impress, MAKE THESE. They actually get better the longer they sit. PRIME picnic food. Veggie Cream Cheese Bagels I packed one last week and used carrots to dip into the extra cream cheese! The Ultimate Veggie Sandwich For the vegetarian in your life! This veggie sandwich is filled with goodness! I bet it would work well on a french roll too. Cobb Salad Sandwich When you canâ€™t decide if you want a salad or a sandwich, this one combines both! Caramelized Onion Frittata What I like about a frittata is that it can be eaten at room temperature. Take a slab and make a sandwich! Cheese and arugula would be lovely additions. Fresh Spring Rolls Wrap these up in a moist paper towel so they donâ€™t dry out. Pack some peanut sauce in a little jar and youâ€™re good to go. Imagine how impressive it would be to pull these out for a picnic! Herbed Goat Cheese Itâ€™s not a sandwich but itâ€™s something that would go really well with a big baguette or crackers! Cold Sesame Noodles Fill a deli container with them. Throw them in your bag. Theyâ€™re so tasty and filling! Cold Soba Noodles Another winner! You can omit the avocados if youâ€™re worried about them turning brown. But then againâ€¦pack a lime like I did and youâ€™re cool. Mediterranean Pasta Salad Who doesnâ€™t love a pasta salad? This one has so many amazing things in it. Throw some arugula in it and go to town! Beet Salad with Poppyseed Dressing Iâ€™d probably add some goat cheese to this beet salad. Knowing me, Iâ€™d probably add some arugula too! Thai Broccoli Salad I can vouch that this one travels well!! It also gets better with age Coconut Quinoa Coleslaw Bring a little jar of the dressing with you! (Youâ€™ll want to drink it!) Farro Salad Another HIT! Add feta if you desire. This one holds up well after a day at the beach. Trust me, I know! Herbed Potato Salad Iâ€™d bring a jar of this potato salad and some arugula to mix into it. This is one of my favorite potato salads ever! Cilantro Hummus Bring a bag of chips and some prepped veggies to dip!!! Make your own trailmix. Itâ€™s soooo much cheaper than buying it and you get exactly what you want in it. Nuts and salami! Add cheese too! Spicy Cucumber Limeade Take a batch of this with you! Your friends are in for a real treat. Earl Grey Soda Bring some bubbly water and the early grey concentrate for a bubbly iced tea! Minted Iced Tea Another refreshing favorite! Oatmeal Raisin Bars No need to worry about melted chocolate with this treat!! Mocha Energy Bites These are also great if youâ€™re combining your picnic with a hike! Theyâ€™ll give you a boost of energy. Granola Cookies Think shortbread meets granola. YUMMMM Granola Bark Itâ€™s like having a Nature Valley bar but better!! Almond Flour Chocolate Chip Cookies I would probably eat these before they had time to melt Thanks for reading through my Picnic Food Ideas. Next up, picnic packing list essentials! The post Picnic Food Ideas appeared first on Shutterbean.
excerpt: Discover easy picnic food ideas that travel well and taste great in the heat. From make-ahead meals to no-cook snacks, this Shutterbean roundup has everything you need for a perfect summer picnic.

html:
Picnic season is here! Need a little inspiration? Iâ€™ve rounded up some of my favorite Picnic Food Ideas to get you started. Everything on this list is easy to pack, holds up well in the heat, and is perfect for your next outdoor adventure.

Pressed Italian Sandwiches

If you wanna impress, MAKE THESE. They actually get better the longer they sit. PRIME picnic food.Â 

Veggie Cream Cheese Bagels

I packed one last week and used carrots to dip into the extra cream cheese!Â Â 

The Ultimate Veggie Sandwich

For the vegetarian in your life!Â  This veggie sandwich is filled with goodness!Â  I bet it would work well on a french roll too.

Cobb Salad Sandwich

When you canâ€™t decide if you want a salad or a sandwich, this one combines both!Â 

Caramelized Onion Frittata

What I like about a frittata is that it can be eaten at room temperature. Take a slab and make a sandwich!Â  Cheese and arugula would be lovely additions.Â 

Fresh Spring Rolls

Wrap these up in a moist paper towel so they donâ€™t dry out. Pack some peanut sauce in a little jar and youâ€™re good to go. Imagine how impressive it would be to pull these out for a picnic!Â 

Herbed Goat Cheese

Itâ€™s not a sandwich but itâ€™s something that would go really well with a big baguette or crackers!Â 

Cold Sesame NoodlesÂ 

Fill a deli container with them. Throw them in your bag. Theyâ€™re so tasty and filling!Â 

Cold Soba NoodlesÂ 

Another winner!Â  You can omit the avocados if youâ€™re worried about them turning brown.Â 

But then againâ€¦pack a lime like I did and youâ€™re cool.

Mediterranean Pasta SaladÂ 

Who doesnâ€™t love a pasta salad? This one has so many amazing things in it. Throw some arugula in it and go to town!

Beet Salad with Poppyseed Dressing

Iâ€™d probably add some goat cheese to this beet salad. Knowing me, Iâ€™d probably add some arugula too!Â 

Thai Broccoli SaladÂ 

I can vouch that this one travels well!!Â  It also gets better with age ðŸ˜‰

Coconut Quinoa Coleslaw

Bring a little jar of the dressing with you!Â  (Youâ€™ll want to drink it!)

Farro SaladÂ 

Another HIT!Â  Add feta if you desire. This one holds up well after a day at the beach. Trust me, I know!Â 

Herbed Potato SaladÂ 

Iâ€™d bring a jar of this potato salad and some arugula to mix into it. This is one of my favorite potato salads ever!Â 

Cilantro HummusÂ 

Bring a bag of chips and some prepped veggies to dip!!!

Make your own trailmix. Itâ€™s soooo much cheaper than buying it and you get exactly what you want in it.

Nuts and salami!Â  Add cheese too!Â 

Spicy Cucumber LimeadeÂ 

Take a batch of this with you! Your friends are in for a real treat.Â 

Earl Grey SodaÂ 

Bring some bubbly water and the early grey concentrate for a bubbly iced tea!Â 

Minted Iced TeaÂ 

Another refreshing favorite!Â 

Oatmeal Raisin BarsÂ 

No need to worry about melted chocolate with this treat!!Â 

Mocha Energy BitesÂ 

These are also great if youâ€™re combining your picnic with a hike! Theyâ€™ll give you a boost of energy.

Granola Cookies

Think shortbread meets granola. YUMMMM

Granola BarkÂ 

Itâ€™s like having a Nature Valley bar but better!!Â 

Almond Flour Chocolate Chip CookiesÂ 

I would probably eat these before they had time to melt ðŸ˜‰

Thanks for reading through my Picnic Food Ideas.Â  Next up, picnic packing list essentials!
